narrative.title: Czechoslovakian 11Th Infantry Battalion - 1941Q4
narrative.situation: British Infantry Battalion (Czechoslovak) deployed in North Africa during 1941Q4.
narrative.objectives: Infantry battalion organized on British model for garrison/defensive operations. Primary role during Q4 1941 was static defense of Tobruk fortress western sector, regarded as most endangered position.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Experienced in desert warfare and siege conditions after 158 days in Tobruk
High morale and cohesion despite casualties
Effective integration with Polish Carpathian Brigade
Proven defensive tactics against German-Italian assaults
